intro: Pilosella alturgelliana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a clustered inflorescence. Pilosella alturgelliana is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
